title: US growth rate revised up; Ukraine crisis hits markets and eurozone confidence â business live | Business | The Guardian
summary: greek government hopes for 'fresh start ' in troika meetings next week .
imf : ukraine aid package may need recalibrating .
us growth in q2 revised to +4.2 %
german inflation rate steady at 0.8 % in august .
stock markets fall as russia-ukraine tensions flare up .
eurozone economic sentiment hits eight-month low .

documents.title: closing summary
text: that 's all folks , after a day of unimpressive eurozone data , better news from the us , and flaky markets as the situation in ukraine darkened .
a brisk closing summary : european stock markets have fallen as the news that russian troops have crossed the ukranian border pushed the crisis into a new phase .
the wobble began after the ukranian president cancelled a trip to turkey .
analysts reckon the developments could push down shares in the days ahead - capital economics says batten down the hatches ' .
the dash for safe haven assets pushed german bond yields into new record lows .
the imf warned that ukraine 's aid package may need to be renegotiated .
the us economy 's growth rate in the last quarter has been revised up to a 4.2 % annual rate , showing that its recovery is stronger than thought .
economists say it bodes well for growth prospects in the rest of the year , as consumer spending and business investment both improved .

global markets forum ( @ reutersgmf ) u.s. second-quarter gdp revised up to 4.2 percent , but not on imports @ twitterid @ twitterid # privateequity prospects of the european central bank announcing new stimulus measures next week have receded , after germany 's inflation rate came in at 0.8 % this month .
spain fell deeper into deflation , with prices down 0.5 % year-on-year .
germany 's unemployment total rose this month .
and confidence in the eurozone has hit an eight month low , dragged down by worries over geopolitical threats such as ukraine-russia .
emmanual macron , france 's new economy minister caused a stir by suggesting in a newspaper interview that the country 's 35-hour working week could be abolished .
the government has insisted there are no plans , after unions said the idea would not be acceptable .
and in athens , greece 's government has been holding talks ahead of next week 's meeting with the troika , and hopes for a breakthrough in relations with its lenders .
tomorrow we get the latest eurozone inflation data , which could show another fall to just 0.3 % .
there 's new unemployment data too .
cheers , and goodnight .
gw

documents.title: eonia rate turns negative
text: another sign that the financial markets are in a weird state .
the eonia rate - the rate at which eurozone banks charge to lend to each other - has turned negative tonight .
it 's only just negative banks were prepared to pay 0.004 % for the opportunity to lend to a rival .
but it shows the weak demand for loans in the eurozone ; banks are happier to lose a little by lending to each other until tomorrow , rather than committing the capital into real economy .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) boom first negative eonia fixing ever , at -0.004 % .
joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) getting paid to borrow money¦ rt @ twitterid mcdonough : eonia turns negative for the first time :
another shot of athens tonight .
smith

documents.title: greek government hopes for 'fresh start ' in troika meetings next week
text: over to greece where the finance minister is frantically coordinating preparations ahead of potentially make-or- break negotiations between the indebted country and its troika of foreign lenders next week in paris .
from athens our correspondent , helena smith reports .

the flurry of meetings that the greek finance minister gikas hardouvelis has been conducting in his sixth floor office overlooking syntagma square is testament to the sheer significance athens is giving to next week 's talks .
the restart of negotiations with debt-burdened greece 's creditors is being seen as a turning point on which much now hangs .

although devoid of the drama that has engulfed so many of athens ' interactions with those keeping it afloat , officials are calling the talks a potential bifurcation in the road : if the right path is followed , it could pave the way to the country finally exiting years of excruciating outside supervision .
that , in turn , will lighten the weight on a government in power with a wafer thin majority as it enters a potentially politically turbulent fall .

the nation must start the process of exiting the crisis [ so that ] everyone understands that we are going into a new phase , said the coalition government 's deputy leader , evangelos venizelos , emerging from talks overseen by prime minister antonis samaras that were aimed solely at coordinating strategy late wednesday .
but while carefully choreographed for the first time the negotiations will take place outside the borders of greece the paris talks are also full of potential pitfalls .

in his back-to-back meetings today , hardouvelis , an academic known for his pragmatic approach , focused on foreclosures ( long demanded by the troika ) and other neuralgic points in discussions with the justice and other ministers who will also be travelling to the french capital .
greek courts , in particular , have thrown a wrench into progress by declaring several of the troika 's mandated reforms to be illegal and unconstitutional .
one well-placed source said : it is absolutely critical that we are all singing from the same hymn sheet , we have to work as a group .
there can be no loose ends .

ermou , athens ' main shopping street , on august 28 2014 photograph : /helena smith greek officials hope that in a neutral setting , mission chiefs representing the eu , ecb and imf will be able to review greece 's fiscal adjustment programme with fresh eyes before they return to the capital to complete their review later in the month .
another insider added : there wo n't be political tension or demonstrations in the streets .
the atmosphere will be lighter , it could be a fresh start .

hardouvelis , who has not been shy of criticizing the troika in the past , hopes to make headway on the thorny issues of taxation ( levies slapped on greeks since the crisis broke out that he believes to be counter-productive and excessively high ) and debt relief .
with the radical left main opposition syriza party making taxes it 's new line of attack , the government says more than ever it is vital it is cut some slack .
the projected fiscal gap , bank liquidity and red loans , ' an ever-burgeoning problem , will be among the other points of contention .
with greeks numbed but no less angst by the crisis by far the country 's worst in modern times all know the future is fragile .
summing up the mood ahead of the talks earlier today , panos skourletis , syriza 's spokesman felt fit to describe the negotiations as the last tango in paris .
we are living through the last days of this government , he said , accusing samaras of being far removed from the reality of ordinary greeks hit by relentless cuts and tax hikes .
skourletis added : and that 's not because we are in a hurry to take over government positions but because the problems surpassed the red mark long ago .
on all levels the situation is at a point when it can go no further .
we see no prospect of exit from the crisis .

documents.title: ukraine crisis sees european markets close in the red
text: european stock markets have closed with losses across the board , as reports of russian troops fighting within ukraine raised fears that the crisis would escalate further .
german 's dax fell 1.1 % , the french cac lost 0.6 % and the ftse 100 lost 0.3 % , while the moscow market was worst hit , finishing down 1.7 % .
traders at the frankfurt stock exchange today .

kopczynski/reuters jasper lawler of cmc markets says this morning 's eurozone data added to the gloom : shares in europe started on the back foot and never got the chance to take a step forward today after weak german inflation and unemployment data was made all the more worrisome by the prospective of no extra stimulus from the ecb in its upcoming meeting .
downside momentum accelerated for stocks when ukrainian president poroshenko said that 15,000 russian soldiers have been deployed into the donetsk region in the east of the country .
a russian incursion ' into ukraine significantly dents the idea of a de-escalation after the presidential talks yesterday .
here 's how all the main european markets closed , with egypt the only riser : european stock markets , close , august 28 2014 photograph : /thomson reuters

a reminder of why today 's us growth figures were encouraging : robert stein ( @ bobstein ft ) gdp growth revised up to 4.2 % in q2 , but w/ better mix ; more biz investment and exports , lower inventories .
corp profits rebound sharply .

documents.title: capital economics : time for markets to batten down the hatches
text: today 's the day when the ukraine crisis returned to bite the markets again , says julian jessop of capital economics .
he writes : the crisis in ukraine returned to bite the markets again on thursday , as president poroshenko cancelled a visit to turkey citing russian troop deployments in the east of the country .
it is hard to judge whether this is a truly new development , given the evidence of russia 's military involvement that had already accumulated over many weeks .
however , pro-russia separatists have now taken control of the coastal town of novoazovsk and are reportedly ready to move on the strategic port city of mariupol .

it is quite plausible ( based on what happened in crimea ) that russia might want to take advantage of these advances and annex more territory from ukraine , or at least to strengthen its support for the rebels .

the responses in the markets certainly followed the familiar pattern : renewed weakness in equities , notably in the euro-zone and emerging europe , and renewed gains for safe havens , notably us treasuries and german bunds ( with the 10-year yields on the latter setting new lows ) .

some of the sharpest market falls have , understandably , been in russia itself , where hopes that a diplomatic solution to the crisis might be found had triggered a rally in the stock market in the early part of this month .
but the latest events suggest that things are likely to get worse before they get better .
in these circumstances , we expect both russian equities and the ruble to remain weak over the rest of this year .
more reassuringly for others , the price of oil has barely budged and remains near multi-month lows , reflecting ample global supply and weak seasonal demand .
but we suspect that fears of disruption to supplies of russian natural gas via the ukraine will gain traction in the coming days .
of course , all this could blow over quickly as both sides pull back from the brink .
but for now it may be time for the markets to batten down the hatches again , especially ahead of the long weekend in the us ( monday is labor day ) .

this week 's copy of the economist puts the boot into europe 's leaders for their failure to steer hms eurozone into calmer waters , leaving first mate draghi to keep bailing them out again : wolf ( @ wolf renzi holding an icecream in the cover page of the economist this week # nomorelove
marc ostwald ( @ mostwald1 ) # imf # badjoke `` imf says ukraine on track with conditions of loan program '' ( but adds `` the degree of uncertainty continues to be very large ''
this handy chart from sky shows the two separate points where fighting is taking place around the russia-ukraine border .
news

documents.title: imf : ukraine aid package may need recalibrating
text: imf chief christine lagarde .
samson/afp/getty images the international monetary fund has warned that its aid package for ukraine may need to be recalibrated ' if the situation deteriorates .

gerry rice , the director of the international monetary fund 's communications , told reporters at a regular press briefing that : if the situation was exacerbated , the programme would have to be significantly recalibrated , including the financing .
the degree of uncertainty is large .
the imf agreed a $ 17bn aid package for ukraine in april .
rice also answered questions on the news yesterday that imf chief christine lagarde is being been formally investigated for alleged negligence by french magistrates .
he said the imf board will meet very soon to discuss the issue : this has been a process over more than three years .
the board has been briefed on a number of occasions .
the managing director has returned to work .
we do anticipate there will be another briefing of the board very soon .
rice pointed to lagarde 's own statement yesterday , in which she insisted the allegations were without merit : i ca n't give you a sense of the board 's feelings about this .
that is something they will discuss when they have their briefing .
the board has been briefed on a number of occasions , including this year .
on each of those occasions , they have expressed confidence in the ability of the managing director to effectively carry out her duties .
we are completely focused on serving our membership as best as we can .
there are no charges that have been made against the managing director .
there is an allegation .
i would refer you to the managing director 's statement .
[ she believes ] it is without merit .
an appeal has been launched , and she has no intention to resign .
on the imf board meeting over the matter , rice added : i do n't have a date but it 's clearly going to be soon , as soon as possible .
the managing director returned to work today , it takes a little time to set up a board meeting .
we will keep you posted about what is happening .
( with thanks to my colleague angela monaghan )
reuters ' weekly poll of city economists has found that they expect the bank of england to raise interest rates before the federal reserve .
a majority of economists surveyed reckon the first uk rate hike will come in the first quarter of 2015 , with the fed following sometime in the second quarter .
another piece of good news from america - the pending home sales index ( measuring how many people have signed contracts to buy a house ) , has hit its highest level in almost a year .
it rose n 3.3 % in july to its highest point since last august , suggesting the us housing market is up .
michael mcdonough ( @ m mcdonough ) regional pending home sales vs .
existing home sales : { ecwb p 53ff369c01f00019 < go > }

barclays analysts also predict decent us growth for the rest of this year , as america puts the bad weather last winter behind it : james pethokoukis ( @ jimpethokoukis ) us real gdp growth revised up to 4.2 % in q2 - barclays : `` we continue to look for h2 real gdp growth of 2.5 % , up from 1.0 % in h1 as a whole ''

documents.title: ukraine worries hit us stock market
text: the strong us growth figures is n't stopping shares from falling on wall street in early trading .
the dow jones has dropped by nearly 100 points , or 0.6 % , to 17022 , as new york traders show their concern over reports of russian troops making incursions into ukraine ( see details here )

documents.title: capital economics : us economy looking good this quarter
text: these new gdp figures are a good sign for the us economy this year , says paul hales of capital economics : he reckons that it could suggest decent growth in the current quarter : the upward revision was due to faster business investment growth and a smaller drag from net trade more than offsetting smaller positive contributions from inventories and government spending .
the alternative gross domestic income ( gdi ) measure suggests that the economy was even stronger in the second quarter , growing by 4.7 % .
what 's more , the upward revision to the growth of real personal disposable income ( 4.2 % vs. 3.8 % ) bodes well for consumption growth in the second half of the year .
of course , more important is the recent widespread strengthening in the business and consumer surveys , which suggests that gdp growth in the third quarter could be a decent 3.0 % .

so although the weak first quarter means that gdp growth this year as a whole is still likely to be around 2.0 % , a strong second half of the year sets things up nicely for growth of 3.0 % next year .
the rise in corporate profits is also encouraging ; hales points out that domestic earnings outperformed profits overseas .

these higher profits will help companies pay higher wages too we believe there is limited scope for profits to continue to grow rapidly when a cyclical rebound in labour 's share of income is on the cards .
marketwatch ( @ marketwatch ) the 4.2 % growth in second-quarter gdp was helped by an upward revision to business investment
some instant reaction to the news that america 's economy grew faster than we thought last quarter : george pearkes ( @ georgepearkes ) looking at q2 gdp revisions .
it 's all about investment .
non resi investment added 0.35 % from 1st to 2nd read , 0.19 % equipment .
george pearkes ( @ georgepearkes ) another note on q2 gdp .
inventory contribution fell by 27 bps from initial estimate to the second read .
good for q3 estimates .

stephen baines , at investment manager at kames capital , is struck that us government bond yields are still historically low , despite america 's solid growth : stephen baines ( @ spbaines ) if you 'd told someone in 2007 that us gdp would be growing 4.2 % pa and the 10yr ust would be 2.3 % , they 'd think you were mad .

documents.title: us growth in q2 revised to +4.2 %
text: the us economy grew even faster than first thought , highlighting the strength of its recovery after last winter 's disruption .
revised data , just released , shows that america 's gdp expanded at an annual rate of 4.2 % in the second quarter of this year .
that 's around 1.05 % quarter-on-quarter .
the commerce department had initially estimated that gdp rose by 4.0 % annualised ( or 1 % q/q ) .
so it 's a relatively small upgrade , but still better than expected .
business spending , and exports , were both stronger than thought .
joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) boom gdp .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) second estimate of us gdp for q2 comes in at +4.2 % .
slightly better than initial estimate of +4.0 % .
skimming the data quickly , it shows that consumer spending rose by 2.5 % in the second quarter .
business investment spiked by 8.4 % - which suggests us firms grew more confident , and also made investments that had been delayed by the bad winter .
the commerce department raised its forecast for export growth to 10.1 % , up from 9.5 % .
imports still grew faster , though , up 11.0 % ,
credit agricole 's frederik ducrozet has crunched through today 's german inflation data , and reckons that tomorrow 's reading for eurozone cpi could be better than expected .

however , with most economists predicting a fall from 0.4 % to 0.3 % , the figures wo n't be great - as analyst lorcan roche kelly points out : lorcan roche kelly ( @ lorcanrk ) @ fwred upside surprise when we are expecting 0.3 % is probably not going to be enough

documents.title: german inflation , the details
text: the german inflation rate held steady at 0.8 % thanks to a rise in service sector costs , which countered a big drop in energy prices .
food inflation also ticked up .
here 's the details : statistics office christian odendahl ( @ codendahl ) german consumer prices flash estimate : 0.8 % .
no upward surprise despite better state-level data .
jamie mcgeever ( @ reutersjamie ) german inflation steady at 0.8 % in august , as expected , and perhaps the nail in the coffin for any ecb easing next week .

documents.title: german inflation rate steady at 0.8 % in august
text: just in .
germany 's inflation rate has held steady this month , according to data just released by the federal statistics office .
the harmonised german consumer prices index came in at +0.8 % year-on-year for august , the same as last month .
on a monthly basis , prices are flat compared to july .
the figures are broadly in line with expectations .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) german # inflation stable at +0.8 in august .

eurozone out tomorrow the data sets the tone for tomorrow 's eurozone inflation data , which will determine whether or not the european central bank is prompted into taking new monetary policy action at next week 's meeting .
cigolo ( @ cigolo ) german inflation holds steady at 0.8 pct in august
these reports of russian troop movements into ukraine have also pushed investors into safer eurozone government bonds .
german bunds are as popular as ever .
this has driven down the interest rate , or yield , on 10-year bunds to just 0.88 % today .
and the 30-year bund is only yielding 1.72 % , a remarkably low rate of return for a long-dated bond , showing the markets anticipating low growth and inflation in the long-term .
joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) amazing .
rt @ twitterid : germany 's 30-year borrowing costs - yes , that 's thirty - stand at just 1.72 % :
peter spiegel ( @ spiegelpeter ) sr @ twitterid military officer says they see 20,000 russian troops in # ukraine border region .

documents.title: stock markets fall as russia-ukraine tensions flare up
text: global stock markets are in retreat , led by a sell-off in moscow , after ukraine 's president declared that russian troops had entered his country .
russia 's micex has slid by almost 2 % , and the german dax is down 1.3 % , as geopolitics looms over the financial sector again .
the gold prices has jumped by 1 % , as money flowed into safe-haven assets .
the selloff came after ukraine prime minister president petro poroshenko announced he had cancelled a visit to turkey .
confusingly , poroshenko was initially quoted as saying an invasion of russian forces has taken place .
but we 're now seeing that corrected to russian troop movements into ukraine .
maxim eristavi ( @ maximeristavi ) 'this is invasion ' standing in the rain , ukraine 's @ twitterid addresses the nation .

dramatic chris adams ( @ chrisadamsmkts ) reuters correction : poroshenko says russian troops have been brought into ukraine ( not `` russian military invasion has taken place '' ) either way , a new front appeared to be opening up in the russia-ukraine conflict today , at the southern border between the two countries .
one soldier said there was an open war of russia against ukraine , as ukrainian forces dug in around the southern town of mariupol .

my colleague oksana grytsenko reports : a mixture of soldiers , police and volunteers are fortifying a checkpoint designed to defend the city of nearly 500,000 from pro-russian forces who took control of part of the town of novoazovsk , and are gradually moving towards mariupol .
when civilian cars approach the exit of the city leading to novoazovsk , pro-ukrainian fighters warn them to go back for their own safety .
ukrainian fighters falling back from novoazovsk say they have not totally given up the town but are outnumbered by their adversaries .
the right bank [ of the river in novoazovsk ] is ours and the left one is not , leonid matiukhin , ukraine 's army spokesman , told the guardian .

more here : ukraine forces brace for fighting with pro-russian troops at second front ' neil macfarquhar ( @ neilmacfarquhar ) donetsk pr commander tells # russia state tv that up to 4,000 russians have fought in ukraine .
some active duty soldiers `` on vacation . ''

all the main european markets are down : reuters a flurry of newsflashes from reuters also show military movements in the region : reuters reporter in southern russia sees armoured column near russian village about 3 km from ukraine-russian border troops sitting on armoured personnel carriers have dirty faces , one has injured face , one truck is damaged and being towed - reuters reporter troops and vehicles have no military identification markings , vehicle number plates removed - reuters reporter some soldiers wearing white armbands , vehicles marked with white circles - reuters reporter reuters reporter in southern russia sees helicopter with red star on it land next to unit of unidentified troops
back in paris , the french government is trying to defuse the row that broke out this morning after the new economy minister suggested abolishing the 35-hour working week .
prime minister manuel valls ' office has insisted there are no plans to make the french work longer hours .
in a statement , it said : the government has no intention of going back on the legal length of the working week .
we should remember that emmanuel macron made the comments in an interview before he was appointed to the government , so he was n't outlining new policies .
the robust response from the unions ( who insisted the matter was a non-starter ) shows how tough a battle it would be

documents.title: falling eurozone confidence blamed on geopolitics
text: today 's slide in eurozone economic confidence shows that the escalating tensions between russia and the west , and unrest in the middle east , are hitting europe 's economy .

jyrki katainen , the former finnish prime minister and current ec commissioner , says : the fall in economic confidence in europe in august , particularly among industry and consumers , is not a surprise following the disappointing second quarter growth figures and the geopolitical tensions that have marked this summer .

( via reuters ) martin van vliet , a senior economist at ing , agrees : it seems that the ongoing geopolitical tensions are finally starting to take their toll on overall sentiment across the euro region .

documents.title: deutsche bank fined for reporting failings .
text: deutsche bank is taking a turn on the naughty step today .
it 's just been fined â£ 4.7m by the city watchdog , the fca , for failing to record almost 30 million derivative transactions .
this makes deutsche the 11th firm to be fined for reporting failings .
fca enforcement director tracey mcdermott says there is simply no excuse for not getting it right .

documents.title: eurozone economic sentiment hits eight-month low .
text: europe 's businesses and consumers are less confidence about economic prospects , according to the latest survey conducted by the european commission .
the ec found that morale in the retail , consumer and industry sectors has fallen this month , to its lowest level of 2014 .
industry managers are more cautious about future production , while retailers are increasingly worried about the present and future situation .
this may reflect geopolitical worries , such as the tensions between russia and ukraine , as well as recent disappointing economic data .
the report also shows that households may be losing faith in the european central bank 's ability to meet its inflation target .
price expectations among consumers hit the lowest level in four years ( see graph below ) .
here 's the key points : economic sentiment in the region has fallen , to 100.6 on its index from 102.1 in july consumer sentiment is down too , dropping to -10.0 from -8.4 in july .
this wipes out the recovery in confidence reported in recent months , with businesses across the economy becoming more downbeat .
the ec says : after a broadly flat development over the last five months , august 's decrease shifted the euro area headline indicator back to its december 2013 level .
worsened sentiment resulted from deterioration in retail trade , consumer , industry , and , to a lesser extent , services confidence .
construction confidence remained broadly unchanged .
most eurozone countries are more pessimistic this month : sentiment dropped significantly in italy ( -4.1 ) , sending the esi below its long-term average of 100 , and in germany ( -1.9 ) .
milder contractions were booked also in france ( -0.6 ) and the netherlands ( -0.8 ) , while sentiment remained flat in spain .

the decline in consumer confidence was due to people becoming more worried about long-term employment prospects , the general state of the economy , and their households ' future financial prospects .
while this chart shows how inflation expectations among consumers and companies have fallen ( despite ecb chief mario draghi repeatedly insisting they remain well-anchored ) .
inflation expectations .
photograph : /ec here 's the full report .

documents.title: csr rejects takeover bid , shares soar
text: csr , the cambridge-based internet of things chipmaker , has just told the city that it has turned down a takeover approach .
in a brief statement , the company said it had rejected an approach from us-based microchip technologies , and is now pondering its options .
csr told shareholders that : the board of csr plc ( csr ) notes recent press speculation and confirms that it has received an approach regarding a possible offer for the company from microchip .
the price proposed by microchip has been rejected and the board is considering its options for the company .
shares in csr have soared by around 25 % this morning as traders anticipate a bid battle .
the financial times reported early this morning that csr could be sold for up to $ 3bn .
last night it was worth under $ 1.6bn .
more details in nick fletcher 's early-morning market report : ftse falters but chipmaker csr soars on $ 3bn sale hopes
amid the steady stream of economic data , italy 's retail sales slide has bottomed out .
sales were flat month-on-month in june , after a 0.6 % decline in may .
that left spending 2.6 % lower than a year ago , due to weak consumer spending and weak price rises .
food spending rose in june , but non-food sales declined .
more german regional inflation data has hit the wires , and it also suggests the overall reading ( at 1pm ) wo n't be a shocker .
consumer prices in bavaria rose by 0.1 % month-on-month , and are 0.8 % higher annually - in line with the forecast for germany overall .
north rhine westphalia cpi was also a little stronger than expected , up from 1.0 % year-on-year to 1.1 % .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) figures look consistent with eurozone headline hicp at 0.3 % yoy and core stable at 0.8 % .
not the kind of shock needed for sovereign qe .
and this chart shows that while m3 money supply has up , loans to private firms in the eurozone are still falling , albeit at a slower rate .
reuters the ecb will be hoping that recently announced stimulus measures will help .
its new tltro programme should encourage eurozone banks to lend more .

documents.title: eurozone money supply up
text: we also have encouraging news on money supply in the eurozone .
the m3 measure of money supply ( the broadest one ) , jumped by 1.8 % year-on-year in july .
that beats expectations of a 1.5 % rise .
ecb ( @ ecb ) monetary developments in the euro area the report also shows another worrying drop in loans to the private sector , down 1.6 % year-on-year .
but the headline figure is being taken as a positive signal ; it takes a bit of pressure off mario draghi at the ecb to launch a quantitative easing programme .
the euro has strengthened a little. , up 0.15 % at $ 1.3211 .
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) ez m3 beats at 1.8 % thats quite a good signal for a change .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) m3 details - weak credit flows pre aqr : +2bn for households ; -16bn for non-financial corporations ( adj .
for securitisation ) .

documents.title: german unemployment total rises , but rate steady at 6.7 %
text: just in : the number of people out of work in germany has risen this month .
the seasonally adjusted jobless total rose by 1,000 in august , to 2.901 million people , dashing predictions of a fall of around 5,000 people .
stripping out seasonal factors , the unadjusted total rose by 2.902m this month , up from 2.871m in july .
the headline seasonally adjusted rate was unchanged , though , at 6.7 % .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) german unemployment rises marginally by 1k in august ( rt poll was for -5k ) , unemployment rate holds steady at 6.7 %
update : laurent berger , head of the cfdt trade union , went on to insist that france 's 35-hour week could not be abolished , as economy minister macron suggests .
he told tv news that : it is out of the question .
the subject is closed .
( quote via reuters )

documents.title: french economy minister takes aim at 35-hour week
text: france 's economy minister emmanuel macron , left , hugging his predecessor arnaud montebourg who was fired this week for criticising the country 's austerity plans .
laurent/epa france 's new economy minister has raised the possibility of abolishing the country 's 35-hour working week in a bid to improve competitiveness , angering the country 's unions .
speaking to le point magazine shortly before he was appointed , emmanuel macron said that france suffers from two specific problems - weak competitiveness , and its budget deficit .
one solution , he suggested , would be to allow firms to break away from current rules on working hours , as long as unions agreed .

macron said : we could authorise companies and sectors , provided there is a majority ( union ) agreement on this , to have exceptions to the rules on working time and remuneration frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) new french economy minister macron hints at what could be the end of the 35-hour week , in an interview with le point .
frederik ducrozet ( @ fwred ) macron also said tax hikes were `` too much '' and while spending needs to be cut , one should be careful due to deflation risks .
macron 's suggestion ' has not gone down well with french unions .
laurent berger , head of the france 's moderate cfdt trade union , has already declared that macron had made a mistake by giving the interview .
itele ( @ itele ) laurent berger ( cfdt ) sur @ twitterid : `` cette interview de monsieur macron est une erreur '' # 35heures the le point interview is here , but behind a paywall .
the france bleu radio network has more details here .
the saxony inflation data also shows significant drops in the price of energy , and food , echoing a recent trend in the eurozone .
marc ostwald ( @ mostwald1 ) # german # cpi closer look at saxony data shows headline as expected flat m/m all about big drag from food ( -0.6 % m/m ) and fuels ( -1.9 % m/m )

documents.title: saxony inflation data released
text: the first slice of german inflation data is out , and it 's mildly reassuring .
prices in the saxony region were flat month-on-month in august , which left the saxony consumer prices index up 0.8 % year-on-year , unchanged from july .
that could suggest that the main german cpi reading , at 1pm , wo n't be the major shock that could spark action from the european central bank world first ( @ world first ) flat saxony cpi .
6th largest state by population
and here 's a chart with some details of spain 's 0.6 % growth last quarter - with household spending and building work both rising .
edward hugh ( @ edward hugh ) details on spain 's 0.6 % q-o-q gdp .
houshold consumption up 0.7 % q-o.q , net trade negative , construction up 0.9 % q-o-q
this chart shows spain 's slide into deflation in recent months : holger zschaepitz ( @ schuldensuehner ) # deflation deepens in # spain .
august hcpi -0.5 % on year vs -0.4 % on year in july but a tad better than expected .

documents.title: spanish inflation rate hits -0.5 %
text: prices in spain 's shops kept falling this month , highlighting europe 's weak inflation problem .
the spanish consumer prices index slid to minus 0.5 % year-on-year for august , down from -0.4 % in july .
it looks like the weakest reading in five years ; economists had been braced for an even bigger drop .
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) spain cpi is mildly better than expected at -0.5 % v -0.6 % expected .
so that is good news for the eur at the margins .
lemasabachthani ( @ lemasabachthani ) spain aug. consumer prices fall annual 0.5 % , most since 2009

documents.title: spanish q2 growth confirmed at +0.6 %
text: spain 's statistics office has confirmed that its economy outpaced the eurozone in the last quarter , with gdp expanding by 0.6 % .
that beats germany ( which contracted by 0.2 % ) , france ( flat ) , and the eurozone average ( +0.1 % ) in april-june .
luis benguerel ( @ luisbenguerel ) spain 's gdp expands 0.6 % q/q in 2q ; prelim expansion 0.6 %
overnight , uk chancellor george osborne has been warned that britain is still strugging to boost its exports , despite the economic recovery .
the british chambers of commerce said osborne is missing his target of doubling exports by the end of the decade , as it slashed its targets for export growth .
more here : george osborne will miss uk export target , bcc warns

documents.title: german cpi and unemployment in focus
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the world economy , business and finance .
it 's all eyes on germany and the eurozone this morning , with fresh data giving an insight into conditions in europe 's largest economy .
it will also indicate whether the european central bank will unleash new stimulus measures next week .
the german consumer prices index , released at 1pm bst , could show whether europe is slipping closer to deflation .
economists predict that prices were flat month-on-month , meaning the cpi would be up just 0.8 % year-on-year .
a weaker reading could give the ecb the impetus to ease monetary policy .
there 's regional data to watch out for through the morning , too , and inflation data from spain .

ransquawk ( @ ransquawk ) saxony cpi coming up in 10 minutes , one of the main events of this morning as the first reading into german inflation ahead of ecb next week frankfurt insiders were playing down the prospect of action at next week 's meeting , unless the main eurozone inflation reading - due on friday morning is particularly poor .
new german unemployment data is then released at 8.55am , shortly followed by new m3 money supply data - another factor which the ecb will weigh up when deciding what to do next week .
the flurry of data continues at 10am bst , with new eurozone confidence data that will show whether recent signs of economic weakness are spooking consumers and businesses .
this afternoon , we 'll get a reminder of how europe is falling behind america , with the second estimate of us gdp for the second quarter of 2014 ( at 1.30pm bst ) .
the initial reading showed the us growing at an annual rate of 4.0 % .
in the corporate world , there 's results from recruitment firm hays and bookmaker paddy power to digest .
and we 'll be watching greece , where the government is preparing for the next session of talks with its international lenders , next week
